channel.title: Question on router(not about "why can't I get people online")
channel.description: O.k. I talked to my friend yesterday on msn and he said you can't portforward on a wireless router BUT if my dad has a laptop that connects to my computer using that router, does that mean I can portforward on the laptop and host on this computer? I've tried for hours, more like days to figure out why I couldn't portforward. *no wonder no one answered my questions about why people couldn't log onto my server*. This may save me from all this stress :]

item.title: Question on router(not about "why can't I get people online")
item.dc:creator: @ddsowns ddsowns
item.description:
@ddsowns wrote:

You can portforward on a wireless router :P. Click Here
Select your router, then read the guide. Also once you portforward your labtop has the same ip as your Desktop [Home Computer] So therefore you may host on the labtop.
If this doesn’t help, please PM me 'cause I most likely won’t return to this thread.

Have Fun.

Read full topic
item.source: Question on router(not about "why can't I get people online")
